question: Is this on?
answer: That's fine.

question: I can break through walls, I just can't...
answer: That's fine.

question: I can't get this on.
answer: So, Mr. Incredible...do you have a secret identity?

question: Every superhero has a secret identity. I don't know a single one who doesn't. Who wants the pressure of being super all the time? No matter how many times you save the world, it always manages to get back in jeopardy again. Sometimes I just want it to stay saved, you know? For a little bit. I feel like the maid. ''I just cleaned up this mess. Can we keep it clean for ten minutes?''
answer: I could get to that point.

question: ''Please?''
answer: Wait, no, don't get up. We're not finished.

question: Tour bus robbery. I've still got time. Officers. Ma'am. Squeaker.
answer: Cool! Ready for take-off!

question: What the...? Who are you supposed to be?
answer: Well, I'm lncrediBoy.

question: What? No. You're that kid from the fan club. Brophy. Brody. Buddy! Buddy!
answer: My name is lncrediBoy.

question: Look, I've been nice, I've stood for photos, signed every scrap of paper you pushed at me but this is...
answer: No, you don't have to worry about training me. I know all your moves, your crime fighting style, favorite catch phrases, everything! I'm your number one fan! Hey! Hey, wait!

question: You know...you can tell a lot about a woman by the contents of her purse, but maybe that's not what you had in mind. Elastigirl.
answer: Mr. lncredible.

question: No, it's all right. I've got him.
answer: Sure, you've got him. I just took him out for you.

question: Sure, you took him out. His attention was on me.
answer: A fact I exploited to do my job.

question: My job, you mean.
answer: A simple thank you will suffice.

question: Thanks, but I don't need any help.
answer: Whatever happened to ''ladies first''?

question: Well, whatever happened to equal treatment?
answer: Well, we could share, you know.

question: I work alone.
answer: Well, I think you need to be more...flexible.

question: Are you doing anything later?
answer: I have a previous engagement.

question: Now, you just stay here. They usually pick up the garbage in an hour.
answer: Hey, lncredible!

question: Hey, Frozone!
answer: Shouldn't you be getting ready?

question: With counseling, I think you'll come to forgive me. Wait a minute. Bomb Voyage.
answer: And lncrediBoy! Hey, hey! Aren't you curious about how I get around so fast? See? I have these rocket boots--

question: Go home, Buddy.
answer: What?

question: Now.
answer: Can we talk? You always say be true to yourself, but you never say which part of yourself to be true to. Well, I've finally figured out who I am. I am your ward... lncrediBoy!

question: And now, you have officially carried it too far, Buddy.
answer: This is because I don't have powers, isn't it? Well not every superhero has powers, you know. You can be super without them. I invented these. I can fly. Can you fly?

question: Fly home, Buddy. I work alone.
answer: Just give me one chance! I'll show you. I'll go get the police.

question: Buddy, don't!
answer: It'll only take a second, really.

question: No, stop! There's a bomb!
answer: Let go! You're wrecking my flight pattern! I can do this if you let go!

question: Will you just...? I'm trying to help! Stop!
answer: Let go of my cape!

question: Take this one home. And make sure his mom knows what he's been doing.
answer: I can help you. You're making a mista---hey!

question: The injured jumper. You sent paramedics?
answer: They've already picked him up.

question: The blast in that building was caused by Bomb Voyage who I caught in the act robbing the vault. Now, we might be able to nab him if we set up a perimeter.
answer: You mean he got away?

question: Any other night, I'd go after him myself, but I really gotta go. But don't worry. We'll get him! Eventually! Is the night still young?
answer: You're very late.

question: How do I look? Good?
answer: Oh, the mask! You still got the mask.

question: Showtime.
answer: You're late. When you asked me if I was doing anything later, I didn't realize you'd actually forgotten. I thought it was playful banter.

question: It was playful banter.
answer: Cutting it kinda close, don't you think?

question: You need to be more... flexible.
answer: I love you, but if we're gonna make this work, you've gotta be more than Mr. lncredible. You know that. Don't you?

question: I do.
answer: As long as we both shall live. No matter what happens.

question: Excuse me. Claims, Bob Parr.
answer: I'm calling to celebrate a momentous occasion. We're now officially moved in.

question: Yeah, well, that's great, honey. In the last three years don't count because...
answer: Because I finally unpacked the last box. Now, it's official. Ha, ha, ha. Why do we have so much junk?

question: Listen, honey, I've got a client.
answer: Say no more. Go save the world one policy at a time, honey. Oh! I gotta go pick up the kids from school. See you tonight.

question: Bye, honey. Excuse me. Where were we?
answer: I'm on a fixed income, and if you can't help me, I don't know what I'll do.

question: All right, listen closely. I'd like to help you, but I can't. I'd like to tell you to take a copy of your policy to Norma Wilcox on... Norma Wilcox. W-l-L-C-O-X. On the third floor. But I can't. I also do not advise you to fill out and file a WS2475 form with our legal department on the second floor. I wouldn't expect someone to get back to you quickly to resolve the matter. I'd like to help, but there's nothing I can do.
answer: Oh, thank you, young man.

question: Look, I know it's you! He puts thumbtacks on my stool.
answer: You saw him do this?

question: Well...not really. No. Actually, not.
answer: Oh, then how do you know it was him?

question: I hid a camera. Yeah, and this time, I've got him. See? You see? You don't see it? He moves! Right there! Wait, wait! Right there! Right as I'm sitting down! I don't know how he does it, but there's no tack before he moves and after he moves, there's a tack. Coincidence? I think not! Don't ''Bernie'' me. This little rat is guilty! You're letting him go again? He's guilty! You can see it on his smug little face. Guilty, I say, guilty!
answer: Dash, this is the third time this year you've been sent to the office. We need to find a better outlet. A more...constructive outlet.

question: Dash, this is the third time this year you've been sent to the office. We need to find a better outlet. A more...constructive outlet.
answer: Maybe I could, if you'd let me go out for sports.

question: Honey, you know why we can't do that.
answer: I promise I'll slow up. I'll only be the best by a tiny bit.

question: Dashiell Robert Parr, you are an incredibly competitive boy. And a bit of a showoff. The last thing you need is temptation.
answer: You always say, ''Do your best.'' But you don't really mean it. Why can't I do the best that I can do?

question: Right now, honey, the world just wants us to fit in, and to fit in, we just gotta be like everybody else.
answer: Dad always said our powers were nothing to be ashamed of. Our powers made us special.

question: Everyone's special, Dash.
answer: Which is another way of saying no one is.

question: No, I'm not.
answer: You make weird faces, honey.

question: Do you have to read at the table?
answer: Uh-huh. Yeah.

question: Smaller bites, Dash. Yikes! Bob, could you help the carnivore cut his meat?
answer: Ow.

question: Dash, you have something you wanna tell your father about school?
answer: Well, we dissected a frog.

question: Dash got sent to the office again.
answer: Good. Good.

question: No, Bob, that's bad.
answer: What?

question: Dash got sent to the office again.
answer: What?! What for?

question: They caught you on tape and you still got away with it? Whoa! You must have been booking. How fast did you think were you going?
answer: Bob! We are not encouraging this.

question: I'm not encouraging, I'm just asking how fast...
answer: Honey!

question: Great. First the car, now I gotta pay to fix the table...
answer: The car? What happened to the car?

question: Here. I'm getting a new plate.
answer: So, how about you, Vi? How was school?

question: So, how about you, Vi? How was school?
answer: Nothing to report.

question: You've hardly touched your food.
answer: I'm not hungry for meatloaf.

question: Tony Rydinger.
answer: Shut up!

question: Well, you are.
answer: I said, shut up, you little insect!

question: You sit down! You sit down! Violet!
answer: ''Simon J. Paladino, longtime advocate of superhero rights, is missing''? Gazerbeam.

question: Bob! It's time to engage. Do something! Don't just stand there! I need you to intervene!
answer: You want me to intervene? Okay. I'm intervening. I'm intervening!

question: Violet, let go of your brother!
answer: Get the door.

question: So now I'm in deep trouble. I mean, one more jolt of this death ray and I'm an epitaph. Somehow I managed to find cover and what does Baron Von Ruthless do?
answer: He starts monologuing.

question: He starts monologuing! He starts like this prepared speech about how feeble I am compared to him. How inevitable my defeat is, how the world will soon be his! Yada, yada, yada.
answer: Yammering.

question: What are we doing here, Bob?
answer: Protecting people.

question: Nobody asked us.
answer: You need an invitation?

question: I'd like one, yes. We keep sneaking out to do this, and...you remember Gazerbeam?
answer: Yeah. There was something about him in the paper.

question: He had trouble adjusting to civilian life, too.
answer: When's the last time you saw him?

question: I don't see anyone from the old days, Bob. Just you. And we're pushing our luck as it is.
answer: Oh, come on.

question: A fire. We're close! Yeah, baby!
answer: We're gonna get caught.

question: Woohoo! Haha!  Fire! Yeah!
answer: Is that everybody?

question: Yeah, that's everyone.
answer: It better be.

question: Can't you put this out?
answer: I can't lay down a layer thick enough! It's evaporating too fast!

question: Well, what's that mean?
answer: It means it's hot! And I'm dehydrated, Bob!

question: You're out of ice? You can't run out of ice! I thought you can use water in the air!
answer: There is no water in this air! What's your excuse, run out of muscle?

question: I just can't go smashing into walls! The building's getting weaker by the second! It's gonna come down on top of us!
answer: I wanted to go bowling!

question: All right! Stay right on my tail! This is gonna get hot! Yeah. Uh-oh. Oh, good.
answer: Oh, now...that ain't right!

question: Oh, now...that ain't right!
answer: Freeze! Freeze!

question: I'm thirsty.
answer: I said freeze!

question: I'm just getting a drink.
answer: Alright. You've had your drink. Now I want you to...

question: I thought you'd be back by 11 .
answer: I said I'd be back later.

question: I assumed you'd be back later. lf you came back at all...you'd be ''back later''.
answer: Well, I'm back, okay?

question: Is this rubble?
answer: It was just a little workout. Just to stay loose.

question: You know how I feel about that, Bob. Darn you! We can't blow cover again!
answer: The building was coming down anyway.

question: What?! You knocked down a building?!
answer: It was on fire. Structurally unsound. It was coming down anyway.

question: Tell me you haven't been listening to the police scanner again?
answer: Look, I performed a public service. You act like that's a bad thing.

question: It is a bad thing, Bob! Uprooting our family again, so you can relive the glory days is a very bad thing.
answer: Reliving the glory days is better than acting like they didn't happen!

question: Yes! They happened! But this, our family, is what's happening now, Bob. And you are missing this! I can't believe you don't want to go to your own son's graduation.
answer: It's not a graduation. He's moving from the fourth grade to the fifth grade.

question: It's a ceremony!
answer: It's psychotic! They keep creating new ways to celebrate mediocrity but if someone is genuinely exceptional...

question: This is not about you, Bob. This is about Dash.
answer: You want to do something for Dash? Then let him actually compete. Let him go out for sports!

question: I will not be made the enemy here! You know why we can't do that.
answer: Because he'd be great!

question: This is not about you!
answer: All right, Dash. I know you're listening. Come on out.

question: Vi? You, too, young lady.
answer: Come on. Come on out. It's okay, kids. We're just having a discussion.

question: Now?
answer: Sit down, Bob. I'm not happy, Bob. Not happy. Ask me why.

question: Okay. Why?
answer: Why what? Be specific, Bob.

question: Why are you unhappy?
answer: Your customers make me unhappy.

question: What, you've gotten complaints?
answer: Complaints I can handle. What I can't handle is your customers' inexplicable knowledge of lnsuricare's inner workings! They're experts. Experts, Bob! Exploiting every loophole, dodging every obstacle! They're penetrating the bureaucracy!

question: Did I do something illegal?
answer: No.

question: Are you saying we shouldn't help our customers?
answer: The law requires that I answer no.

question: We're supposed to help people.
answer: We're supposed to help our people! Starting with our stockholders, Bob. Who's helping them out, huh? You know, Bob, a company...

question: Is like an enormous clock.
answer: ...is like an enormous clo--yes. Precisely. It only works if all the little cogs mesh together. Now, a clock needs to be cleaned, well-lubricated and wound tight. The best clocks have jewel movements, cogs that fit, that cooperate by design. I'm being metaphorical, Bob. You know what I mean by cooperative cogs? Bob? Bob? Look at me when I'm talking to you, Parr!

question: That man out there, he needs help.
answer: Do not change the subject, Bob. We're discussing your attitude!

question: He is getting mugged!
answer: Well, let's hope we don't cover him.

question: I'll be right back.
answer: Stop right now or you're fired! Close the door. Get over here, now. I'm not happy, Bob. Not happy.

question: He got away.
answer: Good thing, too. You were this close to losing your jo--

question: Uh-oh. How is he?
answer: He'll live.

question: I'm fired, aren't I?
answer: Oh, you think?

question: What can I say, Rick?
answer: Nothing you haven't said before.

question: Someone was in trouble.
answer: Someone's always in trouble.

question: I had to do something.
answer: Yeah. Every time you say those words, it means a month and a half of trouble for me, Bob. It means hundreds of thousands of taxpayer's dollars.

question: I know.
answer: We gotta pay to keep the company quiet. We gotta pay damages, erase memories, relocate your family. Every time it gets harder. Money, money, money, money. We can't keep doing this, Bob! We appreciate what you did in the old days, but those days are over. From now on, you're on your own. Listen, Bob. Maybe I could relocate you, you know, for old times' sake.

question: No, I can't do that to my family. Everyone just got settled. I'll make it work. Thanks.
answer: Take care of yourself.

question: Uh-oh.
answer: You are one distracted guy.

question: Hmm? Am I? I don't mean to be.
answer: I know you miss being a hero and your job is frustrating. I just want you to know how much it means to me that you stay at it anyway.

question: Honey? About the job?
answer: What?

question: Something's happened.
answer: What?

question: The, uh...
answer: What?

question: The company is sending me to, uh, a conference.
answer: A conference?

question: Out of town. And I'm just gonna be gone for a few days.
answer: They've never sent you to a conference before. This is good, isn't it?

question: Yes.
answer: You see? They're finally recognizing your talents. You're moving up.

question: Yes.
answer: Honey! This is wonderful!

question: Yes, it is. This is Mr. lncredible. I'm in.
answer: The Omnidroid 9000 is a top secret prototype battle robot. lts artificial intelligence enables it to solve any problem it's confronted with. And, unfortunately...

question: Let me guess. It got smart enough to wonder why it had to take orders.
answer: We lost control. And now it's loose in the jungle, threatening our facility. We've had to evacuate all personnel from the island for their own safety.

question: How am I going in?
answer: The Omnidroid's defenses necessitate an air drop from 5000 feet. lts cloaking devices make it difficult to track. Although we're pretty sure it's on the southern half of the island. One more thing. Obviously it represents a significant investment.

question: You want me to shut it down without completely destroying it.
answer: You are Mr. lncredible. I've got to warn you, it's a learning robot. Every moment you spend fighting it only increases its knowledge of how to beat you.

question: Shut it down. Do it quickly. Don't destroy it.
answer: And don't die.

question: Am I overdressed?
answer: Actually, you look rather dashing.

question: I take it our host is...
answer: Oh, I'm sorry. He won't be dining with us. He hopes you'll understand.

question: Of course. I do usually make it a point to know who I'm working for.
answer: He prefers a certain amount of anonymity. Surely, you of all people understand that.

question: I was just wondering, of all the places to settle down, why live...
answer: With a volcano? He's attracted to power. So am I. It's a weakness we share.

question: Seems a bit unstable.
answer: I prefer to think of it as misunderstood.

question: Aren't we all?
answer: Volcanic soil is among the most fertile on Earth. Everything at the table was grown right here. How does it compare?

question: Everything's delicious. Jeez.
answer: Hurry, honey. Or you'll be late for work. Have a great day, honey.

question: Thanks.
answer: Help customers, climb ladders...

question: Bring bacon?
answer: All that jazz.

question: Weren't you just in the news? Some show in Prayge... Prague? E, I just need a patch job. Must have happened a long time ago. What do you mean? You designed it. A new suit? Where the heck am I gonna get a new suit? Wait. You want to make me a suit? Yeah. Yeah, something classic, like Dynaguy! Oh! He had a great look! Oh, the cape and the boots... Isn't that my decision? Listen, E... Thunderhead was not the brightest bulb... E, you can't generalize about these things. You know I'm retired from hero work. E, I only need a patch job. For sentimental reasons. You're the best of the best, E. I got it, I got it! Don't answer it, honey, I got it! Hello?
answer: We have a new assignment for you. How soon can you get here?

question: I'll leave tomorrow morning.
answer: See you there.

question: Goodbye.
answer: Who was that, honey? The, uh, office?

question: Another conference. Short notice, but you know...duty calls.
answer: Bob?

question: Yeah, what's up, honey?
answer: Ha... have a great trip.

question: Thanks, sweetie. I'll call you when I get there.
answer: I love you. So much.

question: Hello, Mr. lncredible. Nice suit.
answer: Thanks. Nice to be back, Mirage.

question: You'll be briefed on your assignment in the conference room at two. D Wing, room A-113.
answer: 2:00. Got it.

question: It's bigger! It's badder! Ladies and gentlemen, it's too much for Mr. lncredible! Whoa! Whoa! It's finally ready. You know, I went through quite a few supers to get it worthy to fight you, but man, it wasn't good enough! After you trashed the last one, I had to make some major modifications. Sure it was difficult, but you are worth it. I mean, after all...I am your biggest fan.
answer: Buddy?

question: My name is not Buddy! And it's not lncrediBoy either! That ship has sailed. All I wanted was to help you. I only wanted to help! And what did you say to me?
answer: Fly home, Buddy. I work alone.

question: It tore me apart. But I learned an important lesson. You can't count on anyone. Especially your heroes.
answer: I was wrong to treat you that way. I'm sorry.

question: See? Now you respect me, because I'm a threat. That's the way it works. Turns out there's a lot of people, whole countries who want respect. And they will pay through the nose to get it. How do you think I got rich? I invented weapons. And now I have a weapon only I can defeat. And when I unleash it, I'll get-- You sly dog! You got me monologuing. I can't believe it. It's cool, huh? Zero-point energy. I save the best inventions for myself. Am I good enough now? Who's super now? I'm Syndrome! Your nemesis and... Oh, brilliant! All right, try this one on for size, big boy.
answer: Gazerbeam. ''Kronos?''

question: Oh, hello. This is Helen Parr. Bob Parr is my husband. I was wondering if you could give me the number of the hotel he's staying at? The number I have is no good.
answer: Mr. Parr no longer works at Insuricare.

question: What do you mean? He's on a business trip. A company retreat.
answer: My records say his employment was terminated almost two months ago.

question: I am such an idiot. I let this happen, you know. The new sports car, the getting in shape, the blond hair, the lies. Now I'm losing him! What'll I do? What'll I do? Hmm? There's lots of leftovers that you can reheat. Make sure Dash does his homework. And both of you, get to bed on time. I should be back tonight. Late. You can be in charge that long, can't you?
answer: Yeah. But why am I in charge again?

question: Nothing. Just a little trouble with Daddy.
answer: You mean Dad's in trouble, or Dad is the trouble?

question: You sir, truly are ''Mr. lncredible''! You know, I was right to idolize you. I always knew you were tough, but tricking the probe by hiding under the bones of another super? Oh, man! I'm still geeking out about it! And then you had to just go and ruin the ride. I mean, Mr. lncredible calling for help? ''Help me, help me.'' Lame, lame, lame, lame, lame! All right, who did you contact?!
answer: Contact? What are you talking about?

question: I am referring to last night at 2307 hours while you were snooping around. You sent out a homing signal.
answer: I didn't know about the homing device.

question: And now a government plane is requesting permission to land here! Who did you contact?!
answer: I didn't send for a plane.

question: Ah, you'll get over it. I seem to recall you prefer to ''work alone''.
answer: Release me...now!

question: Or what?
answer: I'll crush her.

question: That sounds a little dark for you. Well, go ahead.
answer: It'll be easy. Like breaking a toothpick.

question: You heard her.
answer: Put these on. Your identity is your most valuable possession. Protect it. And if anything goes wrong, use your powers.

question: But you said never to use... I know what I said! Remember the bad guys on those shows you used to watch on Saturday mornings? Well, these guys are not like those guys. They won't exercise restraint because you're children. They will kill you if they get the chance. Do not give them that chance. Mom?
answer: Vi, I'm counting on you.

question: There's something I...
answer: I'm counting on you. Be strong. Dash, if anything goes wrong, I want you to run as fast as you can.

question: He's not weak, you know.
answer: What?

question: Valuing life is not weakness.
answer: Oh, hey. Look, look...if you're talking about what happened in the containment unit, I had everything under control.

question: And disregarding it is not strength.
answer: I called his bluff, sweetheart, that's all. I knew he wouldn't have it in him to actually...

question: Well, not that this isn't fun, but I'm gonna go look around.
answer: What do you think is going on here? You think we're on vacation or something? Mom and Dad's lives could be in jeopardy. Or worse, their marriage.

question: Their marriage? So, the bad guys are trying to wreck Mom and Dad's marriage.
answer: Oh, forget it. You're so immature.

question: Okay, I'm gonna go look around.
answer: Mom said to stay hidden.

question: I'm not gonna leave the cave. Sheesh! Cool! Cool! Vi, Vi!
answer: What did you do?

question: Hey! Hey, Violet! Come here, look.
answer: What?

question: It talks!
answer: What?

question: There. That one.
answer: ''Voice key''? Wait a second...

question: What do we do?
answer: Run!

question: Where are we going?
answer: Away from here!

question: There isn't much time.
answer: No, there isn't. In fact, there's no time at all.

question: Please...
answer: Why are you here? How can you possibly bring me lower? What more can you take away from me?

question: Family survived the crash. They're here on the island!
answer: They're alive? Helen?

question: Hello. You must be Mrs. Incre--
answer: She was helping me to escape.

question: She was helping me to escape.
answer: No. That's what I was doing. Let go of me! Let go, you lousy, lying, unfaithful creep!

question: How could I betray the perfect woman?
answer: Oh, you're referring to me now?

question: Honey?
answer: What?

question: Where's my supersuit?
answer: What?

question: Where is my supersuit?
answer: I, uh...put it away.

question: Where?
answer: Why do you need to know?

question: I need it!
answer: Uh-uh! Don't you think about running off doing no derrin'-do! We've been planning this dinner for two months!

question: The public is in danger!
answer: My evening's in danger!

question: You tell me where my suit is, woman! We are talking about the greater good!
answer: ''Greater good''? I am your wife! I'm the greatest good you are ever gonna get!

question: Run!
answer: My baby!

question: The supers have returned!
answer: Is that Fironic?

question: Fironic?
answer: No, Fironic has a different outfit.

question: We get there when we get there. How you doing, honey?
answer: Do I have to answer?!

question: Kids, strap yourselves down like I told you! Here we go, honey! Ready, Violet? Ready? Now! This is gonna be rough! The robot's in the financial district. Which exit do I take?
answer: Traction Avenue.

question: That'll take me downtown. I take Seventh, don't I?
answer: Don't take Seventh!

question: Great, we missed it!
answer: You asked me how to get there and I told you. Exit at Traction!

question: That'll take me downtown!
answer: He's coming up! Get in the right lane! Signal!

question: Not Traction!
answer: You're gonna miss it!

question: Wait here and stay hidden. I'm going in.
answer: While what? I watch helplessly from the sidelines? I don't think so.

question: I'm asking you to wait with the kids.
answer: And I'm telling you not a chance. You're my husband. I'm with you for better or worse.

question: I have to do this alone.
answer: What is this to you? Playtime?

question: No.
answer: So you can be Mr. lncredible again?

question: No!
answer: Then what? What is it?

question: I'm not...
answer: Not what?

question: I'm not strong enough.
answer: Strong enough. And this will make you stronger?

question: Yes. No!
answer: That's what this is? Some sort of workout?

question: I can't lose you again! I can't. Not again. I'm not... strong enough.
answer: lf we work together, you won't have to be.

question: I don't know what'll happen.
answer: Hey. We're superheroes. What can happen? Vi! Dash! No!

question: Do we have to have cheerleaders at the track meet? I mean, what is that all about?
answer: Hey.

question: Hey.
answer: You're, uh, Violet, right?

question: That's me.
answer: You look different.

question: I feel different. Is different okay?
answer: Hey, different is... Different is great. Would you wanna...

question: Yeah?
answer: Do you think maybe... ...you and I...you know...

question: Yeah?
answer: Do you...

question: Shh. I like movies. I'll buy the popcorn. Okay?
answer: A movie. There you go. Yeah...yeah! Wait, wait...so Friday?
